00004  *      pqxx/largeobject.h

00006  *   DESCRIPTION
00007  *      libpqxx's Large Objects interface

00062 
00066   LargeObject(const LargeObjectAccess &O);                              //[]
00067 
00069 
00072   Oid id() const throw () { return m_ID; }                              //[t48]
00073 
00075   bool operator==(const LargeObject &other) const                       //[]
00076         { return m_ID == other.m_ID; }
00078   bool operator!=(const LargeObject &other) const                       //[]
00079         { return m_ID != other.m_ID; }
00081   bool operator<=(const LargeObject &other) const                       //[]
00082         { return m_ID <= other.m_ID; }
00084   bool operator>=(const LargeObject &other) const                       //[]
00085         { return m_ID >= other.m_ID; }
00087   bool operator<(const LargeObject &other) const                        //[]
00088         { return m_ID < other.m_ID; }
00090   bool operator>(const LargeObject &other) const                        //[]
00091         { return m_ID > other.m_ID; }
00092

00099

00250 // TODO: Create i, o wrappers (easier construction, no template brackets)
00252 /** @warning Still experimental.  May change profoundly.
00253  *
00254  * The standard streambuf classes provide uniform access to data storage such
00255  * as files or string buffers, so they can be accessed using standard input or
00256  * output streams.  This streambuf implementation provides similar access to
00257  * large objects, so they can be read and written using the same stream classes.
00258  */
00259 template<typename CHAR=char, typename TRAITS=PGSTD::char_traits<CHAR> >
00260 class largeobject_streambuf : public PGSTD::basic_streambuf<CHAR, TRAITS>
00261 {
00262 public:
00263   typedef CHAR   char_type;
00264   typedef TRAITS traits_type;
00265   typedef typename traits_type::int_type int_type;
00266   typedef typename traits_type::pos_type pos_type;
00267   typedef typename traits_type::off_type off_type;
00268 
00269   largeobject_streambuf(TransactionItf &T,
00270                         LargeObject O,
00271                         PGSTD::ios_base::openmode mode = 
00272                                 PGSTD::ios::in | PGSTD::ios::out) :     //[t48]
00273     m_BufSize(512),
00274     m_Obj(T, O),
00275     m_G(0),
00276     m_P(0)
00277   {
00278     initialize(mode);
00279   }
00280 
00281   largeobject_streambuf(TransactionItf &T,
00282                         Oid O,
00283                         PGSTD::ios_base::openmode mode = 
00284                                 PGSTD::ios::in | PGSTD::ios::out) :     //[t48]
00285     m_BufSize(512),
00286     m_Obj(T, O),
00287     m_G(0),
00288     m_P(0)
00289   {
00290     initialize(mode);
00291   }
00292 
00293   virtual ~largeobject_streambuf()
00294   {
00295     delete [] m_P;
00296     delete [] m_G;
00297   }
00298 
00299 
00300 protected:
00301   virtual int sync()
00302   {
00303     // setg() sets eback, gptr, egptr
00304     setg(eback(), eback(), egptr());
00305     return overflow(EoF());
00306   }
00307 
00308   virtual pos_type seekoff(off_type offset, 
00309                            PGSTD::ios_base::seekdir dir,
00310                            PGSTD::ios_base::openmode mode =
00311                                 PGSTD::ios_base::in|PGSTD::ios_base::out)
00312   {
00313     if (!mode) {}       // Quench "unused parameter" warning
00314     return AdjustEOF(m_Obj.cseek(offset, dir));
00315   }
00316 
00317   virtual pos_type seekpos(pos_type pos, 
00318                            PGSTD::ios_base::openmode mode =
00319                                 PGSTD::ios_base::in|PGSTD::ios_base::out)
00320   {
00321     if (!mode) {}       // Quench "unused parameter" warning
00322     return AdjustEOF(m_Obj.cseek(pos, PGSTD::ios_base::beg));
00323   }
00324 
00325   virtual int_type overflow(int_type ch = EoF())
00326   {
00327     char *const pp = pptr();
00328     if (!pp) return EoF();
00329     char *const pb = pbase();
00330     int_type result = 0;
00331 
00332     if (pp > pb) result = AdjustEOF(m_Obj.cwrite(pb, pp-pb));
00333     setp(m_P, m_P + m_BufSize);
00334 
00335     // Write that one more character, if it's there.
00336     if (ch != EoF())
00337     {
00338       *pptr() = char(ch);
00339       pbump(1);
00340     }
00341     return result;
00342   }
00343 
00344   virtual int_type underflow()
00345   {
00346     if (!gptr()) return EoF();
00347     char *const eb = eback();
00348     const int result = AdjustEOF(m_Obj.cread(eback(), m_BufSize));
00349     setg(eb, eb, eb + ((result==EoF()) ? 0 : result));
00350     return (!result || (result == EoF())) ? EoF() : *eb;
00351   }
00352 
00353 private:
00355   static int_type EoF() { return traits_type::eof(); }
00356 
00358   static PGSTD::streampos AdjustEOF(int pos)
00359   {
00360     return (pos == -1) ? EoF() : pos;
00361   }
00362 
00363   void initialize(PGSTD::ios_base::openmode mode)
00364   {
00365     if (mode & PGSTD::ios::in) 
00366     {
00367       m_G = new char_type[m_BufSize];
00368       setg(m_G, m_G, m_G);
00369     }
00370     if (mode & PGSTD::ios::out)
00371     {
00372       m_P = new char_type[m_BufSize];
00373       setp(m_P, m_P + m_BufSize);
00374     }
00375   }
00376 
00377   const size_t m_BufSize;
00378   LargeObjectAccess m_Obj;
00379 
00380   // Get & put buffers
00381   char_type *m_G, *m_P;
00382 };
00383 
00384 }
00385 
00386 #endif
